channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Several pot holes, 20th February
item.description:
Several pot holes a few meters from newly resurfaced road (Feb 2021). These potholes have been there for 12+ months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 Tudor Close, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pothole, 20th February
item.description:
A very large area on the top layer of the road has gone on the outbound side of the road near the junction with Armada Close. It has been this way for 4+ years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Mary Rose Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on junction with Mary Rose outbound., 20th February
item.description:
Pothole has been there for many months & is getting bigger and deeper
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Mary Rose Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole now big enough to be repaired, 20th February
item.description:
Previously reported this pot hole twice, but both occasions it has not been classed as requiring repair. Let's hope 3rd time lucky as there are now two potholes appeared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, innsworth lane, 20th February
item.description:
Pothole 15 meters from the zebra crossing towards Innsworth Camp.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 302 Innsworth Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep indentation in tarmac, 20th February
item.description:
Just as you are about to come off the M5 at J11a going south there is a deep hole in the road. It looks like the earth underneath has sunk. You can see it in the daylight if you know where it is but it’s invisible in the dark. I drive a mini and if I catch if it feels very dangerous and might cause major damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Charlie's Way, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole that has the potential to hurt a cyclist or damage a car, 20th February
item.description:
It’s been there at least two weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 404 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A38, Norton

item.title: Dangerous tree, 20th February
item.description:
A tree is falling towards the road and is currently only not falling across the carriageway because it is caught on the telephone wires.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford

item.title: Footpath sunk, 19th February
item.description:
The paving slabs and water meter have sunk outside No::22 Welland Drive. Sank soon after meter installed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Welland Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep potholes, 19th February
item.description:
Large deep potholes in clusters from tewkesbury Road to past the hatherley Manor Hotel. Likely to cause damage to cars and extremely difficult to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley Lodge Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No tarmac left on road in areas., 19th February
item.description:
The whole road surface is coming up, pot holes on the whole width of the road in areas. Has been like it for the last 6 weeks, needs to be fixed before their is a serious accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley Lodge Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes at junction, 19th February
item.description:
Potholes at junction of Fairhaven Avenue and Ansdell Drive which are worsening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Ansdell Drive, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BT cover now damaged, 19th February
item.description:
A colleague reported a month ago that the Bt man hole cover had been damaged BT turned up looked in the wrong direction and reported it not faulty Colleague advised it’s the one opposite the electrical sun station Still not fixed Now... it’s broken through and is a STF hazard under HASAWA with potential for persons to fall through the hole looming... suggest one pulls ones finger out bottom and replaces it It’s on the side with GBE Converge (blue windows)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): G B E C House, 31 Barnett Way, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Major pot hole in The Park, 19th February
item.description:
On main road outside 129 and 131 The Park, GL50 2RG ther is a major pot hole and getting worse by the day. There are sharp sides to the hole and it has already damaged 2 of my tyres.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 125 The Park, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 28 Laxton Road, Abbeymead
